reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Excellent writing. Great sci-fi thriller. Read it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Blake Crouch book. Dark Matter was great and this one is even better! I think it's interesting and really well paced.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A standalone science fiction novel, no sequel or prequel
reviews.reviewText: A standalone science fiction novel, no sequel or prequel. I read the well printed and well bound trade paperback published by Ballantine Books in 2020. I continue to find Blake Crouch interesting and plan to read more of his books in the future.Dr. Helena Smith accidentally creates a time machine when she is building a total immersion gamer system for a game company and does not even realize it. Her assistant realizes that Dr. Smith has built a time machine, imprints himself with a impressive earlier memory, and kills himself. He wakes up in his earlier self and starts rebuilding the time machine.The time machine only runs in reverse to an earlier event in your life that you can easily remember. Such as a new car, the birth of a child, the death of a child, etc. But, the kicker is that the entire planet moves backwards with you in time but, they do not remember where they were before the move back until they reach the time where you activated the time machine. Move backs of a few days are hardly noticed by the population. But move backs of forty years are very much noticed by the population. And everyone wants their own time machine and in that way lies a horrible future.The book moves very slowly to start. Then at the midpoint, it starts moving very quickly with all the jumping around in time. The book is being made into a series on Netflix.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A definite page turner, kept me interested. It’s a very thought provoking look at time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A very intense story, I lost hours of sleep because I couldn’t stop reading this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I wish I could read it for the first time again.
reviews.reviewText: This was….INCREDIBLE! I devoured this book. Not my typical genre, this is definitely a sci-fi thriller that took some brain power to wrap my head around, but so so so good. It should be a movie for sure!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You wont want to put it down
reviews.reviewText: I purchases this novel on recommendation of a friend to accompany me on a recent work trip to Colorado.After the first few pages of this book I was hooked! Crouch is able to develop a very compelling story and play with the concept of time travel in new and exciting way I had not seen before. The book takes place in a handful of locations but two of the locations are New Jersey and Colorado which added an extra fun touch to this novel for me as that was where I was from and where I was traveling to while reading it.The book made the flight pass by quickly and left me wanting to continue reading to see what would happen next.The only downside to the book for me would be it flubs the landing slightly and struggles to close out the story it set up so well. It doesn't take away from the artfully crafted story that was told through out the book but if I had one criticism that would be it.If you like scfi and time travel this novel is for you.

reviews.reviewerName: Fantastic book, great quick read. But the book was really stinky, like it got covered in liquid smoke. I liked reading it, but it was just so smelly. I had to wash my hands everytime I put the book down. This did encourage me to not stop reading, but you could smell it from across the room. Really, really smokey. Not sure how it happened, maybe consider a digital version.
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great But Stinky For Some Reason
reviews.reviewText: I really liked the book. I had a paperback version delivered and it was so stinky. It smelled like it had been covered I'm liquid smoke. Covered. You could smell it from across the room. At first it gave me a headache. I had to let the book air out for a week before I started it. When I did start it the book was great, super quick and fun read. I had to wash my hands everytime I stopped reading, so that helped me finish it faster. I'm sure other versions aren't nearly so smelly. If you're worried, consider a digital version. To reiterate: great book, but really stinky.
A very talented author with a compelling storyline. He writes books for thinkers. I would also recommend Dark Matter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buena historia, digna para convertirse en una película de acción de Hollywood
reviews.reviewText: Buen libro. Te tiene pegado hoja por hoja siguiendo una historia que muchos desean, -poder cambiar momentos importantes de mi pasado-Es hasta un poco después de 3/4 de la historia que se vuelve un poco predecible y “muy palomero” pero aún así no decepciona.
If you liked the series Dark you’ll love this book

I did like this book but I read it after I read dark matter which I loved and so I think I went in with similar expectations and I just didn’t like this one quite as much as dark matter. None the less, it was a good read. I enjoyed the characters, and story line. It jumps between different peoples perspectives and I never found it confusing or hard to follow. One thing I didn’t like was that it didn’t have chapters, rather it more so ended and restarted when changing between the characters perspectives. I prefer chapters.
Interesting concepts, decent character design, minuscule character development, third act is chaotic.
